properties.Name: Position
properties.Description:
A POSITION is a JOB performed by an employee for the  employer for a period.     

It is implied that HR creates a Job and then fills it as a Position, which is based on that Job but may have additional requirements in terms of working conditions, training, certification, physical requirements, skills and duties.

Ex:  POSITION
Senior Executive Assistant to the  VP Of Finance from 8/15/04-7/14/10.

A JOB is defined by HR and consists of one or more duties (responsibilities) that are to be performed in conjunction with that job.    

Ex: JOB
Senior Executive Assistant - Duties include those described for the  executive assistant but require stronger work experience within each function. Supports the  most senior executive, particularly in large corporations. May supervise other administrative staff. Possesses advanced computer skills along with the  ability to train others on system usage. A premium paid for specific industry or market experience.

(1) HR creates JOB = "Senior Executive Assistant"

(2) Two positions for JOB "Senior Executive Assistant" are created and to be filled at Bank Headquarters at Mission Street in San Francisco, CA

(3) One of those position is filled by Jane Smith.

Columns.Name: PositionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Position.

Columns.Name: PositionName
Columns.Description: The name of the Position.

Columns.Name: PositionDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the Position.

Columns.Name: PositionNote
Columns.Description: Comments, notes or additional information regarding the associated Position.

Columns.Name: PositionCreatedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Position was created.

Columns.Name: PositionClosedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Position was closed.

Columns.Name: PositionFirstAvailableDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Position is first available.

Columns.Name: PositionLastAvailableDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Position is last available for filling.

Columns.Name: PrimaryDutiesStatement
Columns.Description: A statement detailing the primary duties to be performed in conjunction with the associated Job/Position.

Columns.Name: SecondaryDutiesStatement
Columns.Description: A statement detailing the secondary duties to be performed in conjunction with the associated Job/Position.

Columns.Name: ExperienceRequirementStatement
Columns.Description: A statement detailing the experience requirements for the associated Job/Position.

Columns.Name: EmployeeDecisionsRequirementStatement
Columns.Description: A description of the decisions that must be made by the Employee in the associated Job/Position.

Columns.Name: WorkingConditionsStatement
Columns.Description: A statement detailing the Working Conditions in which the associated Job/Position will be performed.

Columns.Name: ConfidentialDataRequirementStatement
Columns.Description: A description of the requirements for dealing with confidential information in regard to the Job/Position.

Columns.Name: TravelRequirementStatement
Columns.Description: A statement detailing the travel requirements of the associated Job/Position.

Columns.Name: TravelPercentage
Columns.Description: The percentage of travel required by the associated Position.

Columns.Name: SupervisionRequirementStatement
Columns.Description: A description of the supervision to be performed or required in regard to the Job/Position.

Columns.Name: PhysicalRequirementStatement
Columns.Description: A statement detailing the physical requirements of the Job/Position.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date that the position is filled by the employee.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date that the position is filled by the employee.

Columns.Name: StartingHourlySalaryAmount
Columns.Description: The starting hourly salary that the Employee was paid under the associated Position.

Columns.Name: StartingMonthlySalaryAmount
Columns.Description: The starting monthly salary that the Employee was paid under the associated Position.

Columns.Name: StartingAnnualSalaryAmount
Columns.Description: The starting annual salary that the Employee was paid under the associated Position.

Columns.Name: EndingHourlySalaryAmount
Columns.Description: The ending hourly salary that the Employee was paid under the associated Position.

Columns.Name: EndingMonthlySalaryAmount
Columns.Description: The ending monthly salary that the Employee was paid under the associated Position.

Columns.Name: EndingAnnualSalaryAmount
Columns.Description: The ending annual salary that the Employee was paid under the associated Position.

Columns.Name: SecurityClearanceId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Security Clearance.

Columns.Name: EmploymentTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Employment Type.

Columns.Name: JobId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Job.

Columns.Name: PayGradeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Pay Grade.

Columns.Name: OrganizationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Organization.

Columns.Name: CalendarId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Calendar.

Columns.Name: AuthorizationLevelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Authorization Level.

Columns.Name: PartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Properties.Description:
A POSITION is a JOB performed by an employee for the  employer for a period.     

It is implied that HR creates a Job and then fills it as a Position, which is based on that Job but may have additional requirements in terms of working conditions, training, certification, physical requirements, skills and duties.

Ex:  POSITION
Senior Executive Assistant to the  VP Of Finance from 8/15/04-7/14/10.

A JOB is defined by HR and consists of one or more duties (responsibilities) that are to be performed in conjunction with that job.    

Ex: JOB
Senior Executive Assistant - Duties include those described for the  executive assistant but require stronger work experience within each function. Supports the  most senior executive, particularly in large corporations. May supervise other administrative staff. Possesses advanced computer skills along with the  ability to train others on system usage. A premium paid for specific industry or market experience.

(2) Two positions for JOB "Senior Executive Assistant" are created and to be filled at Bank Headquarters at Mission Street in San Francisco, CA
